intro: Euphrasia arctica subsp. slovaca, commonly known as the Slovaca eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
